Reviews.Title: “Dissatisfied - Average Hotel in, sadly, an average City”
Reviews.Author: Nik D
Reviews.Content: Sorry Trip Advisors, but I wasn't greatly impressed with the hotel or Rome. Starting with the hotel, for the money we paid, it was just about ok. The rooms are spacious but poorly decked out with cheap furniture that was chipped, scratched or worn out. As I had heard about the 15 Euro upgrade for a better room and daily mini-bar, I called on the day we travelled to be sure it would be available. It was, but at high season price of 20 Euros given it was Easter. When we arrived I was then told it was 25 Euros because of Easter - only to argue the case and be told it was actually 15 Euros upgrade plus 5 Euros for internet and 5 Euros for the mini-bar. Make up your minds people. Which fake sales line is it meant to be? Despite this, we used the upgrade and landed a top floor room (703) with great view of Castel Sant'Angelo and St Peter's, but the room was actually smaller than the one we left on the fourth floor (416) and there were red bugs all over the balcony floor. The mini-bar is poorly stocked with things you may not actually eat or drink so we only had that for one night. If you want water every day, just refill your first bottle of water from the 100s of fountains across the city as you travel around. The front desk staff were courteous enough at first, but rude and impatient if you asked questions or disputed anything. Thankfully, the restaurant and room service staff were top notch - really nice, polite and friendly......and that was in the face of some rather obnoxious guests at breakfast making a nuisance of themselves. The room service food was pretty bad, so we only had that on the night we arrived as we got there at 11.30pm. Thankfully Raf Pizza is a restaurant on the back corner of the hotel and is fantastic for pizza, pasta and all the sides. The hotel breakfast was THE saving grace of the whole experience. Absolutely fantastic spread, seemingly constantly restocked, and I would actually go back and stay for this and the location combined - if I were to ever go back that is. The location is perfect. You are literally a 5 minute brisk, or 10 minute gentle walk from The Vatican City, 5 minutes from Castel Sant'Angelo, 1 minute from Via Cola di Rienzo and all the shops, 15 minutes from the all the central attractions, and about 25-30 minutes walk from the Colosseum. If you don't want to walk, you are 10 minutes from a metro station. When you get back, the area is quiet, and close to a number of decent places to eat if you haven't had something whilst out exploring. To sum up, I was expecting more from both the hotel and the city, but I just left feeling I had spent 6 days in a miserable tourist trap and stayed in a hotel that should have been better for the money spent. Dissatisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect staff, best location in the greatest city!!!”
Reviews.Author: RadianMircea
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located 500m from Castel Sant'Angelo and city center, you can walk to all attractions. Staff is excellent, we checked in a little earlier, breakfast is very good, the room was spotless every day, I have only good words for the team in NH Giustiniano. Thanks for a great stay guys!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Retired_55plus
Reviews.Content: This is a modern very good quality hotel in a great location for visiting Rome. The bedrooms are large and confortable, most having a sitting area. The service and breakfast are excellent. An ideal hotel for business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: JJP15
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from the 23rd-28th march 2012 and could not have made a better choice! We arrived at the hotel early due to our early flight time and was able to check in early. The hotel is easy to get to from the airport for both of us it cost us 10euros for a coach and the metro. We decided to get the upgrade and Paid the extra 15 euros per night for free minibar and room upgrade, the room itself was like a flat nice living area with balcony and a very big room every day at 2pm the minibar would get restocked with alcohol,soft drinks,water and snacks. The hotel is just off the main shopping street where you can get everything from the such as clothes,food,market stalls,shoes. There are also a lot of restaurants around so never short of places to eat. The hotel is a 10min walk to the Vatican and there are 2 ways to get there from the hotel and the river fibre is right behind the hotel. The hotel itself is very modern and all the staff are very helpful as a young couple they helped us get on to guest list for 2 nightclubs. Helped us book a cheap coach back to the airport. Confirmed our reservations door our excursions and were very helpful on the whole. We had breakfast included in our stay which had a good variety of food, on the weekend the menu changes a bit to more of a fry up, which I preferred. The hotel has 30min free wifi in the lobby only which you have to get a code for from reception. The room has a clean everyday even when you are staying for longer then a night which is a good thing. I can only say we had a little issue which was them a c not working the room constantly felt hot and stuffy and for me resulted in some sleepiness nights, but I just ended up opening windows together some cool air. I really enjoyed staying at this hotel and think I would stay at this hotel again I think the only thing I missed was a pool as the weather was so nice but it was not essential. Definitely recommend this as a place to stay!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Really Good!”
Reviews.Author: yrenne2000
Reviews.Content: Have enjoyed my time in the hotel very much, even if I was in charge with organziang an event. Very helpful staff, always polite and smiling - didn't feel like work, they've made my job so enjoyable. Nice food, good internet connection and the rooms, a real oasis, newly refurbished. The meeting room with natural light. Excellent prices considering the location - smack down town. I just wish the tv would have been more exciting - with the exception of CNN and BBC, couldn't really watch anything else, everything else was translated in Italian.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, staff,location”
Reviews.Author: Larue
Reviews.Content: Can't wait to go back! love the location, the staff was awesome, especially Margherita Schioppa. She went out of her way to help us have a great staff, but then everyone did. Very close to sight seeing and shopping. Good breakfast as well. I'll be going back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: HollyBloor
Reviews.Content: Great location for everything. Easily accesible from airport by shuttle bus to Piazza Cavour. Plus only a short walk to St Peters and the nearest metro station, from which you can access all of the main tourist sites. The room was spacious and clean, and the breakfast was more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Good, small hotel, but as all in Rome - expensive”
Reviews.Author: VZF
Reviews.Content: Good, small hotel, but as all in Rome - expensive. As other hotels in the center of Rome it is not big, not great amenities, but still nice. As all others it is also quite expensive, but that's Rome I guess. This was a small corporate event for me.

Reviews.Title: “Medium for its money”
Reviews.Author: Evangelos V
Reviews.Content: Clean and decent room but not something exceptional. Quite spacy compared to what i have read in other reviews. Decent breakfast for all tastes. Easily accessible by suttle bus (Piazza Cavour) when coming from the airport. Quiet area near the Vatican. It's not a value for money hotel, but from what i 've searched most of the decent hotels cost over 100 euros/day.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel. Friendly staff. Great location”
Reviews.Author: Marcia282
Reviews.Content: Great location. Just a few minutes' walk from the Vatican. Friendly and helpful staff. Clean room and bathroom. Modern. We were really comfortable and felt at home. Breakfast was good-had variety. Highly recommended. Internet should be free for the price. You get free wifi in the lobby with a 30-minute access code. While you can have several access codes, the breaks between each session made it impossible to work. Also bathroom gets wet easily due to faulty design resulting in waste of towels.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ilias_T
Reviews.Content: i stayed for 2 nights. The hotel rooms were reaally spacious. Room had modern design and furniture was of good taste. The amenities of the hotel were exactly what you will expect. The breakfast had big variety and good quality. Location wise is in 15 minutes walk to metro which is something you should consider. Personally i liked preferred it as it not in the crowded area of the center. Internet is available in the room for an extra charge. Overall i recomend it.

Reviews.Title: “NH GIUSTINIANO. VERY GOOD”
Reviews.Author: edmondoangelaccio
Reviews.Content: Bellissima struttura, in una bellissima zona. Ottima colazione. Camera ok ma un pò spartana, silenziosa, temperatura perfetta, bagno pulitissimo e nel complesso molto buono. Posizione ideale per Vaticano e Piazza di Spagna. Sono totalmente in disaccordo per il parcheggio a 25,00. Very good Hotel, in a beautiful place perfect between Vatican City and Spanish steps. Very good breakfast, silent rooms, bathroom ok. Reception perfect, people kind. i disagree about parking 25,00 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: AL1503
Reviews.Content: A great hotel very conveniently placed for all of the sites of Rome. Our room was on the 7th floor and the views were amazing. The room was great and the breakfasts were delicious. The staff were very friendly, professional and helpful at all times, from the reception staff to the domestic staff and including the breakfast staff. Would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: ChrisT152
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the NH Giustiniano - you get great value for your money! The rooms were amazing: great bed, 2 (!) flat screen TVs, desk and living room set. The location was perfect too - only a few blocks from the Vatican. The next time I travel to Rome I will definitely stay at the NH G. again.

Reviews.Title: “Best staff and location at All.”
Reviews.Author: sfabiani
Reviews.Content: We make a wrong reservation and arrive In a different date. The manager Margarida understand that and give Us a Full refound. The location is perfect. Just few blocks from Vaticano and meters Castel of St Angelo, stores and restaurants

Reviews.Title: “ROME EXCURSION”
Reviews.Author: cujo1957
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely a gem We have been to Rome before and stayed in an older hotel near the Coliseum.This yr we opted for something more modern to go back to, we decided after exploring ancient ruins all day we didn't need to stay in one. this hotel has awesome views of St Peter's a short walk to the Vatican Absolutely wonderful breakfast we did book a delux rm which had a seperate living area and lg balconies No complaints the staff was great Can't imagine how anyone could be disappointed in this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Top rate hotel”
Reviews.Author: kostyalevin
Reviews.Content: The Giustiniano is a top rate hotel located near the Vatican. The area around the hotel is known for housing offices (lawyers and the like) so it is busy during the day, but very quiet at night. One bonus is that finding parking in the evening is not very difficult. The Vatican and Castel Sant'Angelo are mere minutes by foot, and most other major sights can be reached within 15 minutes on foot. The hotel is very modern and the rooms are large and comfortable. I was upgraded to a suite, which was even nicer. The bed was large and very comfortable with many pillows of various sizes. The room had a large desk with wired internet, a sofa and a minibar. It is very easy and comfortable to work in the room. The bathroom was of impeccable quality and adequate size. It has a bidet for all those who use them. The ladies at the front desk were very helpful and spoke good English. One disappointment was the breakfast. Whereas the selection of food was large and varied (eggs, bacon, sausage, cold cuts, cheeses, croissants, etc.) the coffee (espresso & cappucino) was not good. I expect better in an Italian hotel. As you can tell from by sole, relatively insignificant complaint, this is a first rate hotel and I'd return in a heartbeat. However, at its price range it will probably not be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay is guaranteed”
Reviews.Author: John5298184
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, that is equipped with very clean room and comfortable bed! Hotel persons are O.K., and restaurant supplies impressive, delicious and artistic dinner course with reasonable price. I can recommend all traveler who needs quiet stays in one of the most complex cities in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for the money.”
Reviews.Author: GarfieldScotland
Reviews.Content: Would have to agree with all the recent reviews. Hotel is in a quiet location and is only a 10 minute walk to the Vatican. The room upgrade is well worth the 15 Euros. All the staff we dealt with spoke reasonable English and were friendly and polite. The breakfast buffet has an excellent selection with champagne even being available if you desire. Rooms are very modern and the junior suites have a balcony with stunning views. The only minor gripe that I have is that the light on the balcony did not work. As mentioned by other reviews, be sure to pre purchase tickets for the Vatican/Colosseum as the queues are unbelievably long. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend to all and everyone!”
Reviews.Author: lookielou
Reviews.Content: Just got back from this hotel...a little apprehensive as we seemed to be travelling in our car for ages, but were pleasantly surprised to find we were within walking distance of many of the historical sites tourists always want to see, i.e. Trevi Fountain, Vatican City etc. The hotel is very clean and very modern, we were offered an upgrade, but declined as we had no intentions of staying in our room other than to sleep. It didn't matter, the room was wonderful, the staff were extremely courteous and the breakfast is probably one of the best breakfasts we have ever encountered on the contintent! The "waiting on" staff could do with a bit of rocket - they were very slow and crockery did precariously pile up on our table before anyone came to remove the same - but other than that our stay was fantastic. We had booked a twin room but on arrival found the room to be a double, we returned to reception where a smiling and extremely polite member of staff changed the room at the touch of a button. All the reception staff were extremely helpful, offering advice on walking routes and making bookings for various trips and/or restaurants on our behalf. Nothing was too much trouble for them... We didn't use the Metro, bus or tram once as the hotel is so well situated we found that we could walk, the furthest site being the Coliseum, which was approximately 40 minutes walk away - and that was dawdling! We've "done" Rome now so we won't be visiting this hotel again, but I would recommend anyone thinking of going to Rome to at least consider staying there. We will consider staying at a NH hotel in another city should the opportunity arise.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Carrie4896
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed here for 5 days after 14 days with Insight tour for a grand tour of Italy. I was a bit apprehensive initially, because the hotel was also used by other tour company which is lower grade than Insight. Turn out, this is by far the best hotel we have stayed in Italy. It is modern, clean spacious and convienent. For extra 15 Euro, we got upgraded to a Jr. Suite. The upgrade also come with free mini bar and internet. The breakfast is also the best of all the hotels we stayed in Italy. Two of the hotel staff were extremely helpful. One, I think her name is Victoria, is a bit cross.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Travmur
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights, took the upgrade to a suite with balcony as recommended and was not disappointed. Modern and stylish hotel, spotlessly clean. Friendly staff. Great location - a bit away from the tourist drag in a residential neighbourhood close to Vatican city but within walking distance of all the major sites. Metro Lepanto was a couple of blocks away too. Via Cola di Rienzo is a block from the hotel and has some good boutiques and a department store - Coin with a supermarket (Billa) in the basement. There is also a covered fresh produce market on this street which is worth a look. Also on this street is a shop called 'Castroni' which sells all kinds of packaged Italian speciality food and sweets (and worldwide) foods. Beside Castroni, there is a gourmet grocery called Franchi, You can have a quick lunch here – choose from all sorts of food on display – order and pay first before going to the counter. Breakfast was included in the hotel and was excellent - you can even have prosecco if you are so inclined! Pizzeria Raf on the same block at the back of the hotel was good for lunch and dinner - as was Pizzeria San Marco - a block past Raf - both found by turning right and right again when you exit the door of the hotel. full of locals, excellent food and good value. Will stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer041
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and could find very little to fault during our stay. Good location, in a quiet residential area. 10 minute walk to Vatican (which is a must see) We got a taxi to the Colosseum which cost 10 Euros. (another must see) TOP TIP - pre book your tours before you go. The queue's at the Vatican and Colosseum have to be seen to be believed !!! You will save LOTS of time if you do this. Additionally, compare prices for the open top bus tours. Some are MUCH better value than others !! Local bars and restaurants are also close by. We had breakfast during our stay, which we enjoyed. Plenty of choice and served scrambled eggs, bacon, sausages and continental breakfast. On our arrival reception staff were friendly and very efficient. For 15 euros per night, (as recommended on here) we upgraded our room. For this we got a sitting room with a balcony, separate bedroom and en suite. The rooms were lovely and cleaned to a high standard every day. Included in this price is use of a mini bar which was refilled every day. The contents of the mini bar were branded items e.g. Smirnoff and Coca Cola and various snacks. Overall we really enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would use it again on our next visit .

Reviews.Title: “Above expectations! Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Carannah
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night with a "Sleep'n Go" special which is essentially half off the posted price. Due to past experience with such deals with other hotel chains, our expectations were set low. However, we were surprised to find a room that was equivalent of a Junior Suite at other hotels (living room + bedroom). The room was simply the best we stayed at in Rome (past and present). It was clean and stylish with modern hues. Service was prompt and always with a smile. One of the best business hotels I have stayed at... modern stylish foyer. Great location - quiet neighbourhood in a residential area with a local's only high street right at its door step yet only 10 minute walk to Vatican city, Piazza Navona. If you plan to use the metro it is a bit of a walk to either of the servicing metro stations (Ottaviano and Lepanto, roughly 7 minute walk). Con: Mini-bar price was 30% above the rest of the smaller sized hotels we stayed at - internet was not free though high bandwidth.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and modern”
Reviews.Author: Werder1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights for a conference, company-paid. On the plus side, the room ticked most boxes: aircon worked well & quietly nice cool hardwood floor generous bathroom with a window and proper blow-dryer surprisingly spacious bedroom quiet, courtyard-facing spacious wardrobe with 8+ hangers beds have duvets very decent breakfast buffet (for Italy) central-ish location for vatican city, just a short walk north of the castel sant'angelo. Tourist sites Piazza Navona, Piazza di Spagna are just 10-15 minutes away on foot Downsides: internet for a fee reasonably priced at €5/day, but at frustratingly slow dial-up speeds maids came round quite late in the day to make up the room As usual on the continent, king/queen beds are simply two doubles pushed together

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Ident1000
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel in a great location, does not have the ' olde worlde ' charm that some others promise but as a base in Rome it was fantastic 5 minute walk to the Vatican - does not get much better than that ! Nice restaurant next door too so great after a hard day in the city !

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: DarrenRu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 5 nights and took advantage of the 15 Euro upgrade to get a bigger room with free daily minibar - good value. The hotel is about 10 minutes walk from the Piazza del Populo and about 15 minutes walk from the Vatican. Staff were friendly and fairly helpful and spoke quite good English which made it easier for us to communicate. The room was clean, quiet and had a lovely balcony, too.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Josymahosie
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in july in NH Giustiniano. Upon arrival around 10 in the morning, reception informed us that our room wasn't ready yet. We could leave our luggage at reception; but had to change our clothes in the toilets. Other 4star hotels we stayed at had hospitality rooms in which one could take a shower and change; NH Giustiniano does'nt. The breakfast was outstanding. Location of the hotel is ideal. close to the vatican, castel san angelo and bus stop. friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “nice!”
Reviews.Author: farsiderr
Reviews.Content: it was a nice hotel with new and clean room... we were given a room with a small living room area and balcony.. the hotel is near to the vatican and within walking distance of the other places of interests like castel sant angelo (5 mins), spanish steps (15 mins), trevi fountain (15 mins), colessum (20 mins)... only thing is that we had no free wifi...

Reviews.Title: “unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: Sea98
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about 10 minuets walk from the nearest Metro and 20 minuets from the Vatican. Arrived in the evening after a journey from London. The reception was appalling, very unfriendly to say the least. The receptionist has said that we were upgraded! Our room was on the 1st floor facing the street. It was a room for the disabled, with no bath. I did not complain as was too tired. The hotel supplied towels and shampoo for one person only. We requested a double bed but received joint 2 singles. Breakfast was fine, very extensive. 2nd day we arrived back to the room after 15.30 to our great disappointment the room was not cleaned or changed! I called reception, no apology they said a cleaner will come in 5 minuets. I called after 25 minuets and again was advised that she will arrive in 5 minuets. 25 minuets later the cleaner arrived. In general the hotel stuff do not really pay attention to any guest requirements, reception did not supply any useful information regarding Rome or the vicinity. Not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade to suite and refillable mini-bar!”
Reviews.Author: KatieDerbyshire
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern, clean and all the staff were friendly (several of them were quite hot!). The only downside is the location - approximately 10-15 minutes walk to the nearest metro station. But at the same time, it was only 15 minutes to the Vatican and Castel Sant Angelo. It is situated in a residential area: - quiet and (as far we could tell) safe neighbourhood, - local restaurants were not cheap (ranged from £13-£20 per main dish), although the quality of food was quite good, the staff did not welcome English tourists. Would recommend ensuring your map(s) cover all nearby roads and metro stops. When we stayed, the metro stopped running at 9pm on Sundays so we had to find the replacement shuttle bus stops which luckily were easy to find but be wary of which way the bus will be travelling. Getting on the bus going in the opposite direction would mean a 10 minute bus journey could take over an hour! Luckily, we realised this before the bus arrived. If staying, I would recommend upgrading for 15euro per night to stay in a suite with double balcony and nice view. This also includes daily refill of the mini-bar - the contents are worth around 60 euros. With the extortionate prices in Rome, you'd be lucky to spend less than 15 euros on soft drinks and water during the day. The breakfast provided everything we would want (bacon, eggs, sausages toast etc) - plus you could help yourself to champagne which was a nice touch. They also provided a jug of hot milk for coffee which I thought was brilliant. The drink prices in the bar were cheaper than in the tourist areas of Rome and served complimentary bar snacks with your drinks. We did have a minor issue with ants - every evening, we would find two ants foraging around the sink area. As the numbers were small, it wasn't a major inconvenience. But overall, it is a great hotel to stay in and we would recommend our friends and family to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended!!!”
Reviews.Author: stowaway88
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel. Wonderful location. Walking distance to all the attractions (10-25min by foot), and also a bus stop near the hotel. 1min walk from a main street with shops, supermarket (coin), cafés, bars etc. Very safe place to walk in the evening/night. The hotel is modern, clean, very good service and nice breakfast. Disadvantage - Wi-Fi is not free, not even in the lobby and very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and location everything.”
Reviews.Author: ND79
Reviews.Content: We upgraded to the suite which included mini-bar and internet. Great deal and the extra room was a unique treat for Europe. Hotel is located close to Vatican, shopping, subway, restaurants and laundromat. Spotlessly clean, quiet at night, comfortable bed, diverse breakfast and pleasant staff. One of the best stays on our trip through Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, awesome breakfast”
Reviews.Author: TempAd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NH Giustiniano for 5 nights and it was very nice. We were on the 3rd floor and had a balcony facing Via Virgillio. Rooms: The room was fairly big and had a nice balcony. It has hardwood floors throughout, a large desk area and big bathroom. The only problem with hardwood floors (and thin walls) is that you can hear EVERYTHING going on around the room. We could here the conversations in the next room word-for-word and they did not seem to be speaking loudly. The street noise was minimal and a small price to pay for having a great balcony. Hotel lobby: Clean and modern. Lots of seating areas for lounging and relaxing. Staff: Good. The front desk staff have basic English and try their best to be helpful. Everyone smiles and greets you as you arrive and leave the hotel. Location: Close (walking distance) to the Vatican. 5-10 minute walk to the closest Metro station. Lots of shopping and restaurants in the area. Less touristy than staying close to the Spanish Steps area. Can walk to Spanish Steps in 15-20 minutes. Transportation: We took the limo to the airport that the hotel arranged for 50 Euros—well worth it! Very convenient. Issues: The only issue we had was during check-out the front desk staff member quoted us our “total” (over 1000 Euros) and asked for a credit card when we had booked the hotel and pre-paid it through AirCanada.com. He insisted on us producing a “voucher” in-lieu of the credit card. Firstly, this should have been addressed during check-in. Secondly, I have never had to produce a “voucher” at any other hotel where I have pre-paid the stay. He wasn’t unpleasant about the issue, but he wasn’t friendly about it either. Thankfully I had printed out my confirmation email, which he begrudgingly took. Hints: (1) “WHERE” magazine is in the room (they are in many European/USA/Canadian cities) and have an awesome selection of restaurant reviews in all price ranges that change with every issue. I’ve used these recommendations in plenty of cities and have always been happy. Also has a comprehensive list of local attractions, packages, shopping, spas, etc. (2) Ask for a quiet room. Overall: Nice hotel. Definitely would recommend and stay there again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding all round quality and good location. Easily 5 star in some areas. Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Kam_n_Sally
Reviews.Content: Once in a while, a pleasant trip is made outstanding by the quality of accomodation. This is so true of our stay three night stay at the NH Giustiniano, Rome. We arrived on Easter Sunday - arguably one of the busiest days on the tourist calendar. We were also considerably early and, being fully booked, a suitable room was not yet ready but we were able to leave our luggage in their secure storage while we piled in with the hordes at St. Peter Square. The hotel is a stone's throw away from Castel Sant' Angelo and about a ten minute leisurely walk (for a reasonably healthy and fit individual) from Vatican City. Nearest metro stop is Lepanto. We felt that its location was excellent for our purposes, although avid restaurant goers may wish to choose to stay a little more south or east. Having said that, Piazza Navona is only a ten minute walk away, and we had no problem finding or enjoying great food in the evenings. As a routine sales pitch, the reception staff politely, and gently (ie. not pushy) offered a couple of room upgrade options for €10/€15 extra per night. We declined as we had no need for the extra space and facilities (although I'm sure it would have been quite luxurious). Check-in was a polite, swift and efficient process. Our room was on the sixth floor and had an inward courtyard facing view. For the record, do not expect a quaint cloister-like courtyard/garden as this is a large, modern hotel in a city. The windows provided much light and ventilation (had external roller shutters as well as internal muslin nets and blackout curtains), and the room felt secure. The room was large and the décor modern (boutique hotel style), with a solid wooden floor, fantastically large and comfortable bed (medium firm mattress), plenty of storage for clothes, a desk, luggage stand, armchair, LCD TV, digital safe (large enough for a business laptop), fridge (mini-bar), digital air con. The bathroom was a good size and had quality fittings. The only problem was a leaky seal on the shower screen which created a puddle on the floor whenever we showered. From other reviewers, it would appear that this a common problem with the shower screens fitted throughout the hotel. However, this was a minor issue and did not detract from the overal quality of the stay. Despite being fully booked, we experienced no issues with noise coming internally or externally. Housekeeping staff were polite (whenever seen), discrete and efficient. We returned to a spotlessly cleaned room (and bathroom) every day. Wired and wireless internet was available in the room and wireless available in the lobby. The service is provided by Swisscom, a third party network provider, and a one-time daily code needs to be obtained at reception for a free 30 minute session. This policy is to encourage purchase of 24hr sessions. Paid internet access is almost de-riguer in hotels these days so a free 30 minute session is a bonus. Business users, or those who can't live without their social network would benefit from a room upgrade, which is inclusive of internet access throughout, at almost the same rate as purchasing internet access alone. There is a workstation, complete with printer, in the lobby that also operates on the paid system. Buffet breakfast was included in our booking. It's worth the option if not already included. The restaurant/diner is top notch. Seating is plentiful, the décor modern in keeping with the rest of the hotel, and super clean. You would not be dissapointed to walk into this restaurant setting at any level. The restaurant staff were polite, friendly and professional. Even on the fully booked day(s), it was not overcrowded and the food selection was plentiful and well stocked/replenished. The selection was wide and varied and the quality of the food was excellent. Juices were freshly pressed, and a selection of fresh whole or prepared fruits were available everyday. Bread was fresh and there was a wide selection of different pastries (even multiple croissant options), cold meats, cheeses, cereals, yoghurts, teas, coffees – and get this... even bubbly (altho probably a sparkling white)!! The hot food selection was a little limited (do remember that this is continental Europe) but scrambled eggs, sausages and bacon were available so you could still cobble together a pseudo full English (more like a half English!) if that's what you fancy. I must state that the quality of the offerings was excellent – all of the produce was of top rate and not a hint of budget supermarket stuff anywhere. I'm sure I left out some food selections but I would rate the overall breakfast experience as five star quality. A hotel bar exists but this was pretty much deserted as there are plenty of places to wine and dine in Rome. There are also several large and modern conference facilities for the business user. There is also a fitness room with a modest offering containing a treadmill, cross trainer and (I don't quite recall the third machine but probably...) a rowing machine. I did foolishly consider going for a run on the treadmill one morning but, given that we had walked, and were going to walk, for miles n miles for the entire week, rapidly decided against it. Check-out was also a fast and efficient process (I booked direct with NH and recommend this method). In summary, this hotel is a very well run and kept establishment. Rooms are excellent, staff are excellent, facilities and breakfast are also excellent. For the cynical reader, no, I do not work for NH nor am I associated with them in any way! Everybody has different requirements and it is rare to find a hotel that you have truly enjoyed. NH Giustiniano is certainly one of them. This is easily worthy of its four star rating and comfortably better than a number of five star places where I've stayed! An easy recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “good location - would return”
Reviews.Author: rosemary0505
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a group tour of italy and we added two extra nights - We were able to upgrade to a modest suite and free access to the mini bar for 15 euros a night - well worth it - our room had a balcony with a view of the dome of St Peters - really felt like we were in Rome - the Hotel is well located - close to via Rienzo where there are good restaurants and some shopping - within waking distance of many of Rome's major attractions - Breakfast was fine - because it was included i don't know the price but there was lots of fruit and many other choices - Check in was somewhat slow but our flight had arrived - Overall our stay was trouble free and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - poor service”
Reviews.Author: shrilka
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel for 3 nights and in general i'm satisfied. The Location is good, not very near the main attractions. When you start knowing the areas everything looks more near, so don't be scared in the beginning. The Castel Sant Angelo is 10 min by walk and Vatincano is around 20 (slow walk). The center is around 20 minutes. I was surprised that the hotel receptionist didn't warn us that we shouldn't take tour bus, so i'm warning: DONT TAKE TOUR BUSES!!! - the worst tour bus service in the world, so poor, doesn't stop almost nowhere, when you buy the ticket they show you the wrong map, everything is near so see the CITY by WALK, in case you want to WASTE 20e take a bus. To The Coliseum take a metro, or if you want you can go by walk. The Rooms of the hotel were great, clean, big. The only bad thing is the BATHROOM, after taking the shower all the floor is wet! The Breakfast is good if you are there before 9 or at 9, at 9:30 the food starts to disappear and they don't bring more, so fill up your table with food and than start eating, otherwise you ll end up not having a cup for a coffee. As well you should know so italian words, in general the people almost don't speak english.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant staff, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: danz1276
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, not complicated, good stay and brilliant staff. Must pick if you travel to room. Clean and nicely designed rooms and good restaurants around that area.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel slow checking-in”
Reviews.Author: LovingOz
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, stayed here for one night (unfortunately not more) whilst on business. Very clean, modern hotel. My room was basically an apartment, it was huge! Gorgeous living space. Great location, 5/10 minute walk from Vatican city; we were able to find a lovely local restaurant for dinner, sitting out in the street eating dinner during the summer months felt very Italian . There are a lot of restaurants in close proximity of the hotel so you are spoilt for choice. Had a great sleep at the hotel, the bed was comfortable, nice clean bathroom for a shower. The hotel breakfast buffet provided a lot of choice, fresh fruit, yoghurts, continental breakfast etc. no complaints there. The only drawback to this hotel was that checking in was quite slow, there were three people in front of us and it took about 20 minutes to check them all in, they only had two people behind the desk for this. I checked out before I had breakfast to beat the Businessman rush, so check out was quicker.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: inchicore
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here with a group of friends for a weekend. This is a lovely hotel, really well located close to the Vatican and within walking distance of the main sights and shopping districts. The breakfast buffet is excellent and the staff are very helpful. Rooms are fine, more for a business traveler but very comfortable. If you stay here take a walk around the corner to via Cola di Rienzo where you will find some amazing food stores. The hotel has a private car that will take you to and from airport for 50 euro each way which is worth it if there are a few of you Overall I would highly recommend this hotel Overall I would highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: JY521
Reviews.Content: The room is spacious with 2 flat screen TVs, one in the bedroom and another in the sitting area. The room and bathroom are clean and the bed is really comfortable. The hotel also offers great breakfast. The hotel itself is within walking distance to the metro station, which is the cheapest way to travel to and from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, centrally located.”
Reviews.Author: SueBNc
Reviews.Content: Comfortable hotel with safe, minibar, hairdryer, TV, shampoo, soap, toothbrush, shower cap, body wash. Had bathtub with shower. However, the glass shower door is poorly designed and leaks. No coffee maker in room and you cannot get coffee in the hotel before 7:AM. No iron. Electricity is turned off once you leave the room so don't try to charge phones, batteries, etc. while you are away. Fantastic location. Within walking distance to the Vatican/St. Peters, good restaurants and shopping. There is a great supermarket within walking distance on "the Via Cola". Pick up a bottle of wine and cheese (wine is very good and cheap) and bring it back to your room. However, BRING A WINE OPENER with you as there isn't one in the room. The breakfast buffet is very good with a large assortment of cheeses, croissants, bread, yogurt, meats, sausages and scrambled eggs (which are cooked on the"runny"side). However, TAKE YOUR VALUABLES WITH YOU WHEN GOING FOR FOOD. A couple in our party had their laptop and travel bag stolen while they went up for food. Both items were well hidden under their table. The dinner at this hotel was mediocre . . . go just around the block to good, non-hotel restaurants. Suggestions: 1. They had AC but it was centrally located. If you tend to be hot at night, bring a portable fan that works on dual current. An extension cord for this would be handy too. 2. If you like early morning coffee, bring instant with a water heater for your room. 3. There are no such things as "to go" coffee cups. Next time I would bring a coffee travel mug to fill up at the buffet table and take back with me. 4. Pack a wine opener. 5. Every bathroom we used in Italy had toilet paper . . . this wasn't a problem. 6. If you visit St. Peters, go later in the afternoon. The lines to go through security aren't as long and very few tour groups are there in the afternoon. 7. Have a wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “Really great hotel, excellent rooms, great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: trixie1948
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NH Giustiniano for only 2 nights in September and thought it was one of the best hotels we were at in Italy. This hotel has been completely updated and remodeled recently and is a bargain for the money. The location is perfect - within walking distance of the Vatican, Piazzo Navona, and many other places. It is very clean, the breakfast is very good, and the staff was so helpful and polite. We upgraded to the suite (15 euro extra) and although the room was great, we were hardly in the room. There is a great restaurant around the corner, Raf's. We read about it in another review and agreed that it is close and good food. There is also a large shopping area out the main door and to the right. Close, grocery, shops, etc. Loved this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best city and best hotel”
Reviews.Author: PeggyR3
Reviews.Content: We've been to Rome last christmass. Rome was perfect in any way except the fact that no one was speaking English!!! But that wasn't a big problem. You always find a way to communicate. The hotel was excellent. The rooms where great and very clean. We hadn't good view but it was ok. The staff and the breakfast also great. It was not so close and not so far from everything you want to see in Rome. We went around only on foot, (with our 8y old son walking with us). I certenly recommend it .

Reviews.Title: “Very modern, great location, beautiful room”
Reviews.Author: Mrsvic
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 503 for our honeymoon, great room very spacious with living room, bedroom and bathroom, balcony off bedroom with view of castle and basilica. Very nice quiet area, stones throw from the sistine chapel. Hoptel is very new and very modern, has free in room mini safe, in room aircon, feels luxurious and chic. Breakfast was really good with lots of fresh croissants, fruit, cooked and cold options. fresh juices. Would def go back here, really impressed

Reviews.Title: “Modern boutique hotel with large room and great location”
Reviews.Author: SeichanG
Reviews.Content: The hotel is NEW. It is a welcome break from the older hotels that we encountered in Venice and Florence. We picked 4 star hotels and this is the only one that is actually worth the money. The hotel is clean with modern/minimalist decor. The room is large (even for the standard room - great value) for it has a separate seating area with a pull up couch. The location was great for us because we had planned to spend a couple of days at the Vatican and this place is 10-15 minutes walk to the Vatican. There are many small shops around it for you to buy water, etc. The only thing that was a bit surprising was the "rudeness" of the staff. They are just not that friendly...not even greeting you with a simple hi or the familiar bon giorno like we encountered every where else around Italy. It could just be the big city attitude...but other than that, our stay was very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Easy accessible, nice rooms, good value!”
Reviews.Author: grafvondanneberg
Reviews.Content: Finding an avordable and yet nice hotel seemed difficult in Rome. Actually I always prefer hotels reflecting the destination, individually run and in good shape. Well, after some time surfing the web and several websites I went back to chain hotels, as these seemed offering better quality at affordable prices. If it comes to chain hotels I have NH on top of my list: contemporary interior, fairly good locations and prices. So was the NH Giustiniano. Without having been in Rome before I though it a good location. and so it was. only a short walk away you find all sorts of bus lines, that bring you directly in the ancient heart of Rome. The hotel it self is location just next to Castel Sant Angelo, Peters Dome and Piazza del Popolo, so we also walked a lot directly out of the hotel. Metro station Lepanto is about 7 min. walk away. The hotel interior was as expected and as shown on the web: contemporary, clean and straight forward. The rooms are spacious and functional. Some even offer balconies or a view towards Peters Dome. I would have liked more variety on the breakfast buffet, but still was find - eventhough I still don't understand, why in many italian hotels they don't offer a proper coffee in the morning, just a coffee machine at the buffet offering instant coffee! But there are plenty of coffee houses around for a quick espresso. The staff was attentive with typical italian courtesy and they were flexible enough to give us the room when we arrived early. All in all I would definately recommend this place for a visit to Rome on leisure!

Reviews.Title: “could be an amazing place”
Reviews.Author: mic_sam
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, with a few glitch. 1- no safe in the room upon arrival. 2- lack of service in English which is fair enough in an italian country. 3- feels like Canadian are not welcome in your hotel compared with Italian speaking guest. My overall experience as a head hunter for an airline company, very good. As a tourist fairly poor appart from the restaurant which serve amazing food. I had a suite with no view at all :( housekeeping is great. Room service is a joke, avoid it.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Rooms, great Location”
Reviews.Author: carcar47
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Giustiniano for one night after a cruise. It was a close walk to the Vatican, 5 mins. We had 2 rooms, both were huge, they had a promotion to upgrade your room to deluxe including free mini bar for 15Euros, that was well worth it. The floors are all hardwood, so not exactly the quietest place. The bathrooms needed repair, the showers leaked all over the floors, out to the hall and the toilet squeaked when you sat on it, which was scarey! Breakfast was included and that was wonderful, everything from scrambled eggs and bacon the granola, muffins fruit and juices, as well as any kind of coffee. Service not the best, no one offered to help with our bags, even though you had to drag them up some stairs to reach the elevator.....but we learned they do not offer you have to ask. This is a decent hotel for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying in an Ikea Store Room - Distinctly Average”
Reviews.Author: Happyamelie
Reviews.Content: The Hotel itself is based very close to the Vatican - around a 10/15 minute walk. The hotel is distinctly average, and as I did not manage to bag a "bargain", I was left feeling a little cheated. My room had a suite attached, which rather bizarrely had a cooker and hot rings in one of the cupboards (but no pots, pans, plates etc). As has been mentioned before, there is a balcony, but no chairs or tables. There are no curtains, but instead you have to lower a metal shutter down over your window at night time (the street is quite bright, so you have to close the shutter if you want to get to sleep). The beds are completely rock hard, tricky the first night, but then you get used to it. Breakfast is not much to write home about - rolls, some cheese, fresh fruit if you get there in time - but there is the bonus of champagne. This is a long way from a luxury hotel, really just somewhere to sleep, and at this price, a bit of a disappointment. I was woken up at 10.00am on the 2nd day despite a "Do not Disturb" sign that I had placed on the door at 9.00am. The person refused to go away until they could check my mini-bar, even though I had arranged for it to be emptied the day before... Internet is expensive. Good location for Vatican, quiet street, local shops etc, but it is no more than a very basic, no frills, cheaply furnished attempt at a hotel. Certainly not worth the couple of hundred Euros per night that I paid direct through their website. If I had the time to organise it, I think a local B and B would have been substantially better. I would not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, New Hotel for a Reasonable Rate”
Reviews.Author: scowdrey
Reviews.Content: The NH Giustiniano could not have been better for my wife's and my first trip to Rome. It is near the Vatican, but everything worth seeing in Rome is within walking distance. We booked a Deluxe room and took advantage of the 15 euro upgrade to a suite with unlimited use of the mini-bar. The mini-bar access is worth the money in and of itself. The Suite was terrific - a full living room with a separate bedroom with a king-size bed. There was a private balcony running the full length of the suite with 3 separate sets of French doors (2 in the living room, 1 in the bedroom). Our room had a stunning view of St. Peter's. The service was very good. The front desk staff all spoke English. Breakfast was also included and was excellent. They even had champagne available each morning. We booked ground transport from the airport through the hotel. It was 50 euros for a private car. This seemed to be a better option than the train to Termini and then a taxi to the hotel, and not much more money. It saved us from having to lug our bags through the busy Termini station after a long flight. We had no complaints at all. The rates were very reasonable in comparison to every other 4 star hotel in Rome. On on our next trip to Rome, we will definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireDevil
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NH Giustiniano for a few nights during May on our first trip to Italy. The hotel is just what I was looking for ,modern & in a good location. We stayed in a superior room (room 512) with a balcony overlooking the 'inside' of the building. The room & bathroom were a good size & finished to a high standard with all mod cons.The bathroom had a brilliant,powerful rainfall type shower.Tv had lots of european channels & also MTV & BBC World news. Air con was great & not too noisy to use at night. Give the mini-bar a miss though-prices start at 4 euro for a bottle of water. The balcony was a good size-a couple of chairs would have been good, although there is nothing to see from behind the metal shutters on all the balconys on the 'inside' of the building. Breakfast was brilliant-some reviews complain about the choice...but there is everything you could possibly want-really nice food. Loved the bacon,scrambled eggs & the 'mini' sausages! Explore the local streets & you will find some good places to eat etc...try Rafs-just behind the hotel Bud cafe on Via Ovidio Morrisons Irish bar on Via Ennio Quirino Visconti. Prices for beer range from 4 euros with a meal-8 euros sitting outside the Pantheon. I travelled from the airport on the Leonardo express-14 Euros & a taxi to the hotel from Termini was 12 euros. Metro is approx 10 mins walk, Vatican & historic centre approx 15 mins. Rome is a fantastic city & I cannot wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in the Prati area of Roma”
Reviews.Author: kawet
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at this NH and we were really pleased. The room was large (superior one) and there was a balcony (no table or chair to sit :( ). We really enjoyed our stay there, the breafkast was excellent, with a lot of choice, freshly made bread, fresh fruits, yogurts, prosciutto di parma and other italian specialities. We ate at the restaurant twice, the food was really good and the price not too high. The service was great, and they are really generous with wine when you only order a glass. If we get back to Rome, we will certainly try to stay there as it is in the lovely area of Prati, a typical neighborhood of Rome which we particularly appreciated. It is easy to reach from Termini station with the subway to Lepanto and 5 minutes walk to the hotel. The historical center is only 5-10 minutes walk, the Sant' Angelo Castle is 2 minutes away and the Vatican 5 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Hausfrau007
Reviews.Content: The rooms were gorgeous and spotless, the bathrooms big and new and shiny. The breakfast each morning was delicious and plentiful. The hotel is in a nice, quiet area of Rome; a short walk to the Vatican and perhaps a 20 minute walk to the historical centre. The subway (Lepanto station) is also only 10 minutes away and can be utilized to go to all the major sites (highly recommended). I can recommend this hotel whole-heartedly and would go back there any time. Although we booked our trip through Air Canada Vacations as a package, we were able to take advantage of the hotel's offer of upgrading to a suite for only 15 euros per night which included a bigger room on the top floor and unlimited use of the minibar. The 15 euros per hour for Internet was a bit over the top though (didn't use it). I cannot say enough good things about this hotel, and if you've already booked your stay here, look forward to a sanctuary to which you can look forward each night.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: crackerspaz
Reviews.Content: My husband and i went to Rome for our honeymoon. We upgraded to a suite for 10 euros a night and they only charged us for the first night. Our suite was exactly like the hotel pictures. We had an amazing view from our balcony. The bed was amazingly comfortable. The hotel was very close to Castel St.Angelo and Vatican city and close enough to the other attractions that we were able to walk. The breakfast was amazing. We are vegetarian and still had many choices.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust_6282
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on 5th -7th Feb 2010. Check in: The check-in was quick and efficient...we arrived at 11am...and there was no standard room available as check-in is normally at 2pm(standard hotel policy everywhere)...so they offered us the 15 Euro a night upgrade to a Suite (with free minibar) that was available immediately. We took the offer, and are so glad we did!! Room: Room was fantastic! Big and spacious, modern and very very clean! One room with couch, Tv, closet space, minibar and desk and coffee table, other room with king size bed, another TV and small balcony. The bed...OMG!!!so amazing!!!! Large bathroom with bathtub and shower in one, modern basin and clean toilet. Nice selection of toiletries in the bathroom incl the usual shower caps and the more upmarkey dental kit and hand sanitiser. The view from our room (room 502) was great: Castle St Angelo right in front, and St peter's basilica on the right! The only thing I could possibly complain about was that the rooms should have had a tiny balcony/terrace in that direction, so that one could enjoy the view of the vatican without having to stick your head out of the window! lol...but its a small complaint, since everything else was perfect! Location: A mere 5 minutes walk to Castle St Angelo, so of course, its 5 minutes to the vatican (in the opposite direction. In fact, Rome is so small and compact, you can walk pretty much everywhere without getting too tired (comfy shoes a must!). The metro lepanto is near (7 minutes walk), but we found it much easier to just walk to Spanish Steps, Villa Borghese and Trevi Fountain. Food: Here again, only a small complaint: the breakfast selection was not that vast. There was plenty to eat, but not that much choise in terms of variety...especially as I dont eat meat! There are pastries(not very good), cakes, assortment of breads and jams...cheese paltter, cold meats, fruit and a tiny selection of hot (scrambled eggs, bacon and suasage)...nothing else, and no selection of type of eggs for example. i only mention the lack of choice because the standard of the hotel is excellent and they could really improve their breakfast buffet to match the standard they have set. I have been to many hotel buffet brekfasts and have seen a much much wider selection. Breakfast staff very friendly though! Best part of trip: The minibar was refilled the second day...and we were charged nothing! There was so much to drink..;we could not even finish it! There is not much to do in the neighbourhood, the hotel bar is virtually empty, as is the restuarant. We spent 30 minutes walking about outside looking for a coffeeshop before we had to settle on room service! But there is a wonderful restaurant in the same block as the hotel called rafs...the pizza is just simply amazing!!! Its a must try! All in all, fabulous stay in Rome, helped by the fact that we lived in the lap of luxury for 2 nights and enjoyed every minute of it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very good food and service!”
Reviews.Author: Perbott
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pretty good. It has many room which have been refurbished, very spacious and well decorated. Fortunately, as soon as we arrived, the receptionist offered us a package for only 15 euros per day, for upgrading our room and free mini bar, it worked really good. Its location is very near Castel Sant'Angelo and Vatican City, but also about seven minutes walking from Piazza Navona. Breakfast is superb and the restaurant offers fresh delicious food.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Zuccero
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome for a short get away break. The hotel location was ideal very near to a metro station, very close to lot's of shops, restaurants, bars etc. You could walk almost everywhere (if you enjoy waking of course!). The hotel staff was very helpful, neat hotel very clean and tidy rooms, excellent and with great variety breafast.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable luxury in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: BroadwayK
Reviews.Content: Superb 4-star hotel in the heart of Rome. Just a few blocks walking distance to the A Line metro station. Extremely clean rooms with new furniture and hardwood flooring. Flat screen television (and a phone in the bathroom - just in case you need to make an important call) Full breakfast in the mornings. Complimentary internet voucher available at the front desk for use on the computer in the lobby. Mom and I would stay here again in an instant!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel money can buy in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Rinaki_Athens
Reviews.Content: I've been in Rome a lot of times before but I always stayed in overpriced hotels near Piazza di Spagna. This last time I decided to change and it was great. Although I had read lots of good reviews about this hotel before our arrival, I was a little bit anxious of what I would find. Its not very cheap but comparing to the prices of the other hotels in Rome its neither very expensive and I can assure you its worth every penny... The most important thing for me is location. I thought it would be a little bit out of the historical center but I was totally wrong! Its only 5 min walk from the very center (castel sant'angelo, via del corso etc). Its situated on a very quiet street and in the summer you can easily sleep with the windows open. It also has high standard air conditioning - if you like that. The room we got (a standard one - no lux or anything) was huge. It was actually two separate rooms (a living room and a separate bedroom), very modernly furnished and a big modern bathroom. Every room had its own lcd tv, there was a nice sofa in the living room, an office bla bla bla. The room also had a small balcony (without chairs though). The breakfast covered everything (from fresh fruits, all kinds of cereal, sweets, croissants, all kinds of bread, cheeses, ham, eggs, yogurts, marmelade) - what else can anyone ask for? and its always in the price of the room. The girls - guys at the reception were friendly enough. Cleanness was very good. To sum up, I'm definitely going back again and again and again... taxi from or to airport - 40€.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and Spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: lovingandloved
Reviews.Content: This hotel within decent walking distance from St Peters and Castel St Angelo wich was a plus, rooms very spacious and super clean, the bathrooms were reaaaaally nice and beautifully presented.... The only thing i didnt like was the staff, which werent rude but a little indiferent.... contrary to the experiences ive had with smaller hotels or hotels run by families.... Theres interntet in the rooms but if u didnt bring ur laptop u had to use the comp in the loby wich was quite expensive. Around $.70 per minute!!!! One tip, do not ask for a taxi in the hotel (unless u have ur luggage with you)couse the starting rate would be 6 euros instead if u go outside, walk a little and catch one on the streets then ud save 2 euros. Overall its a very nice hotel but not cozy or charming like id prefer.... NExt time ill look for something more romantic (though i would recomind this one)

Reviews.Title: “A miracle in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ViajanteLisboa
Reviews.Content: Set in a peaceful area, very close to the Vatican, Piazza Navona, Castel Sant'Angelo and other major atractions, this modern hotel, with very large and confortable rooms, equipped with simple but trendy furniture, is the perfect place to stay in Rome! The staff was very helpful and the breakfast very rich for a city hotel! To sum up, a MIRACLE in Rome with an excellent value for the money!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: AussiegirlLux
Reviews.Content: If you don't mind a little exercise, this is a great place to stay. It is a new hotel in a quiet part of Rome, just across the river and only a short walk from Castelo d'Angelo (Castle of Angels) as seen in "Angels and Demonds". The bed was massive and extremely comfortable. I would have liked to have slipped a pillow in my case., they were heavenly. The room was nicely decorated and the air conditioning was most welcomed. Breakfast was included in the price and was a vast buffet ranging from fresh fruits and juices, cereals (named brands), huge variety of breads, rolls, meats and cheeses. You could even have a panna cotta for breakfast if you fancied. The hotel is not in the centre of room, and the price reflects this. There is a variety of well priced restaurants and bars in the area if you want to enjoy a quieter evening in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel and perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: crazymel
Reviews.Content: TUTTO PERFETTO.everything about this hotel was perfect. The room, the buffet breakfast(it had everything!!),the location, walking distance to the centre, just off Cola Di Rienzo which is one of the main shopping streets, walking distance to th vatican, 6 minutes walking distance from metro station, bars all around the hotel. Hotel is clean, rooms are nice, modern. everything was perfect.

HotelInfo.Name: NH Giustiniano
HotelInfo.Address: Via Virgilio, 1 E/ F/ G, 00193 Rome, Italy
